items.title: FCC says it's investigating Disney and ABC over DEI efforts
items.content: The Federal Communications Commission is investigating the Walt Disney Company and its ABC unit over its diversity, equity and inclusion efforts.

items.title: Canadians pull back on U.S. trips, threatening to widen United States' $50 billion travel deficit

items.title: Startup founder Charlie Javice found guilty of defrauding JPMorgan Chase in $175 million deal

items.title: Why GM stock is getting hit the hardest by Trump auto tariffs
items.content: Roughly 30% of GM vehicles sold in the U.S. during the first three quarters of 2024 were assembled in Canada and Mexico.

items.title: Detroit automaker shares fall after Trump's tariff announcement
items.content: President Donald Trump said he would place 25% tariffs on "all cars that are not made in the United States."

items.title: Ferrari says it will raise prices by 10% on some models to offset auto tariffs
items.content: Ferrari produces all of its cars at its Maranello factory. Last year, the company produced 13,752 cars.

items.title: U.S. health department plans to slash 10,000 jobs as RFK Jr. upends agencies

items.title: Peyton Manning’s Omaha Productions sells 10% stake to new Patrick Whitesell-led platform at a valuation of more than $750 million, sources say

items.title: How a Dungeons & Dragons livestream became a multiplatform media company

items.title: KB Home unveils its first 'fire-resilient' community in Southern California

items.title: Federal housing agency will not cut Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac loan limits, new director says

items.title: How the rich use insurance to invest in private credit without steep tax bills
items.content: Private credit is a hot asset class but comes with hefty income taxes. Top earners can save on tax with specific insurance policies known as PPVA and PPLI.
